info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 01 at 9:23PM MDT until August 01 at 9:45PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN YUMA COUNTY... At 920 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Highland Center to near Wray to 6 miles southeast of Bonny Reservoir, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE... At 915 PM MDT, a mesonet weather station at Wray Airport reported a 61 mph wind gust. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Wray around 925 PM MDT. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 234 and 265. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
